Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a fish in its natural water habitat and label the fish.
The student can include other plants or animals that live in or near the same water habitat as the fish, though labels might occasionally be incomplete.
The student can label basic needs such as water and food effectively, showing a clear understanding of the fish's requirements.
The student can illustrate the fish swimming in water, linking it to its environment accurately.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label specific places like lakes or rivers, occasionally omitting them entirely (e.g., may label it vaguely as 'body of water').

The student might not fully illustrate or label the relationships between the fish, its environment, and other components; minor elements may be missing or unlabeled (e.g., the relationship between fish and aquatic plants).
The student might not consistently demonstrate how the water habitat provides resources beyond basic needs like water and food (e.g., shelter might be overlooked or implied but not labeled).
The student may fail to fully integrate or label the system showing how the components work together, leading to some parts being only partially connected or illustrated.
